messages.content: What is the purpose of ComfyUI-WorkflowCheckpointing?
ComfyUI-WorkflowCheckpointing automatically creates checkpoints during workflow execution to minimize progress loss if a workflow is canceled or ComfyUI crashes.
Where are checkpoints saved by default in ComfyUI-WorkflowCheckpointing?
By default, checkpoints are saved locally to a checkpoint folder in ComfyUI-WorkflowCheckpointing.
How can networked checkpoints be enabled in ComfyUI-WorkflowCheckpointing?
Networked checkpoints backed by the Salad Simple Storage Service can be enabled by setting the `SALAD_ORGANIZATION` environment variable in ComfyUI-WorkflowCheckpointing.
How does ComfyUI-WorkflowCheckpointing handle authentication when deployed to Salad?
When ComfyUI-WorkflowCheckpointing is deployed to Salad, authentication is automatically pulled.
How can an API key be applied when testing ComfyUI-WorkflowCheckpointing locally?
An API key can be applied when testing ComfyUI-WorkflowCheckpointing locally by setting the `SALAD_API_KEY` environment variable.
How does ComfyUI-WorkflowCheckpointing handle caching for multiple users?
If a request sent to `/prompt` contains a `client_id`, it is utilized by ComfyUI-WorkflowCheckpointing to allow independent caching of executions by multiple users.
How can the `FORCE_CRASH_AT` setting be used in ComfyUI-WorkflowCheckpointing?
The `FORCE_CRASH_AT` setting can be set to an integer in ComfyUI-WorkflowCheckpointing to terminate workflow execution at a given sampling step, which facilitates testing.
